intro: Psittacanthus pangui, commonly known as the Guadaloupe fern, is a tropical plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen, leathery fronds. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, with creeping underground stems that help in vegetative propagation. Its foliage is typically dark green and glossy, often with a slight waxy coating. Psittacanthus pangui is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
